newsitem.title: KAZAKHSTAN: Kazakhstan returns Teck right to develop mine.
newsitem.headline: Kazakhstan returns Teck right to develop mine.

text.p: Kazakhstan's government has returned the right to develop the Vasilkovskoye gold mine to Canada's Teck Corp, a senior government official said on Thursday.
State Property Committee chairman Sarybai Kalmurzayev told Reuters a preliminary agreement had already been signed.

In June Teck won a tender to develop the North Kazakh deposit with reserves of 14 million ounces, but lost the exclusive right because of disagreement about the investment plan proposed by the Kazakh government.
The investment plan provided for paying $35 million before August 11 in a bonus payment to Placer Dome Inc, which left the deposit last year.
Kalmurzayev said Teck had already paid $7.5 million in damages and a $5 million collateral. But the cost of the project had risen to $92.5 million from $85.0 million.
Kazakhstan estimates the Vasilkovskoye deposit reserves at 390 tonnes.
Under the tender terms, the mine must raise production to 15 tonnes a year from the current 500 kilogrammes.
